com.lehman.ic9.net

Class ssh

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.lehman.ic9.net.ssh

  • public class ssh
extends java.lang.Object
    Implements SSH connection functionality.
    Author:
    Austin Lehman

    • Constructor Summary

      ssh(java.lang.String Host, java.lang.String UserName, java.lang.String Password, int Port)
      SSH connection constructor that takes connection information as parameters.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ssh

        public ssh(java.lang.String Host,
           java.lang.String UserName,
           java.lang.String Password,
           int Port)
        SSH connection constructor that takes connection information as parameters.
        Parameters:
        Host - is a String with the host to connect to.
        UserName - is a String with the user name to connect with.
        Password - is a String with the password to connect with.
        Port - is an int with the port number to connect to. (22)

    • Method Detail

      • connect

        public void connect()
             throws ic9exception
        Attempts to establish a connection to the remote host.
        Throws:
        ic9exception - Exception

      • disconnect

        public void disconnect()
        Disconnects from the remote host.

      • print

        public void print(java.lang.String Data)
           throws ic9exception
        Prints the provided string to the SSH connection.
        Parameters:
        Data - is a String with the data to print.
        Throws:
        ic9exception - Exception

      • println

        public void println(java.lang.String Data)
             throws ic9exception
        Prints the provided string with a newline character to the SSH connection.
        Parameters:
        Data - is a String with the data to print.
        Throws:
        ic9exception - Exception

      • isConnected

        public boolean isConnected()
        Checks to see if the SSH session is connected.
        Returns:
        A boolean with true for connected and false for not.

      • isChannelConnected

        public boolean isChannelConnected()
        Checks to see if the SSH channel is connected.
        Returns:
        A boolean with true for channel connected and false for not.

      • read

        public java.lang.String read()
                      throws ic9exception
        Reads a single byte from the SSH stream and returns it as a String.
        Returns:
        A String with the read byte.
        Throws:
        ic9exception - Exception

      • readUntil

        public java.lang.String readUntil(java.lang.String Until)
                           throws ic9exception
        Reads from the SSH stream until the provided string is matched. Note that if the provided string is never found this method will read/block indefinitely.
        Parameters:
        Until - is a String to match.
        Returns:
        A String with the read data.
        Throws:
        ic9exception - Exception

      • setConnectTimeout

        public void setConnectTimeout(int TimeoutMills)
        Sets the connect timeout in milliseconds. (Default is 3000) This must be set prior to calling connect or it has no effect.
        Parameters:
        TimeoutMills - is an int with the connect timeout in milliseconds.

      • getConnectTimeout

        public int getConnectTimeout()
        Gets the connect timeout in milliseconds.
        Returns:
        An int with the connect timeout in milliseconds.

      • setStrictHostKeyChecking

        public void setStrictHostKeyChecking(boolean StrictHostKeyChecking)
        Sets the strict host key checking flag. True is for yes and false is for no. (Default is no.) This must be set prior to calling connect or it has no effect.
        Parameters:
        StrictHostKeyChecking - Is a boolean with true for strict checking and false for not.

      • getStrictHostKeyChecking

        public boolean getStrictHostKeyChecking()
        Gets the strict host key checking flag. True is for yes and false is for no. (Default is no.)
        Returns:
        A boolean with true for yes and false for no.
